thread.title: State’s tallest Tricolour attracts tourists

author: tribuneindia.com
title: State’s tallest Tricolour attracts tourists
text:
Our Correspondent
Dalhousie, October 19
The tallest (108 feet) Tricolour in the state, installed on the premises of Dalhousie Public School (DPS) on October 19 last year, has now become an added attraction to tourists. The Tricolour was inaugurated by Vice-Admiral Anurag G Thapliyal, AVSM & BAR, Director General, Indian Coast Guard, on the occasion of the 44th Founders’ Day of Dalhousie Public School. A MiG-21 fighter aircraft is already installed on the school campus. Army Commander, Western Command, Lt Gen KJ Singh, AVSM, did the installation ceremony of the T-55 Russian Origin Battle Tank on the DPS premises as a war trophy on June 3 this year. The spot presents a spectacular view with the giant Tricolour fluttering in the backdrop of the MiG-21 fighter aircraft, surface-to-air Pichora missiles and the T-55 battle tank. DPS Director-Principal, Dr (Capt) GS Dhillon said here today that efforts were afoot to have a naval representation by placing a ship alongside the other war trophies. “National pride is a soldier’s ultimate pride and the display of defence hardware has a powerful motivational impact in joining the defence services”, he said.
